from bokeh.io import output_file,show,output_notebook,push_notebook
import pandas_bokeh
from bokeh.plotting import figure
from bokeh.models import ColumnDataSource,HoverTool,CategoricalColorMapper
from bokeh.layouts import row,column,gridplot
from bokeh.models.widgets import Tabs,Panel,DataTable, TableColumn
from bokeh.palettes import Spectral3
output_notebook()
pandas_bokeh.output_notebook()
pd.set_option('plotting.backend', 'pandas_bokeh')

source.75e9fb0b:
from math import pi
from bokeh.io import output_file, show
from bokeh.palettes import RdYlBu,Viridis
from bokeh.plotting import figure
from bokeh.transform import cumsum


x = {
      "India":5851,
      "United States of America":2237,
      "Other":1388,
      "Brazil":694,
      "Japan":638,
      "Russia":582,
      "United Kingdom and Ireland": 489,
      "Nigeria":476,
      "China":474,
      "Germany":404
}

data = pd.Series(x).reset_index(name='value').rename(columns={'index':'country'})
data['angle'] = data['value']/data['value'].sum() * 2*pi
data['color'] = RdYlBu[len(x)]

gp = figure(plot_height=400, title="Distribution of Kagglers in Top Ten Countries-2020", toolbar_location=None,
           tools="hover", tooltips="@country: @value", x_range=(-0.5, 1.0),background_fill_color="beige", plot_width=600)

gp.wedge(x=0, y=1, radius=0.4,
        start_angle=cumsum('angle', include_zero=True), end_angle=cumsum('angle'),
        line_color="white", fill_color='color', legend_field='country', source=data)

gp.axis.axis_label=None
gp.axis.visible=False
gp.grid.grid_line_color = None

gp.title.text_font_size = '18pt'
gp.title.text_color = "maroon"
gp.title.text_font = "times"
gp.title.text_font_style = "italic"

show(gp)
source.1e98e70a:
w = {
        "Master’s degree":7859,
        "Bachelor’s degree":6978,
        "Doctoral degree":2302,
        "Some college/university study":1092,
        "Professional degree":699,
        "I prefer not to answer":399,
        "High school":240
}

data = pd.Series(w).reset_index(name='value').rename(columns={'index':'country'})
data['angle'] = data['value']/data['value'].sum() * 2*pi
data['color'] = Viridis[len(w)]

p = figure(plot_height=350, title="Formal Education among Kagglers", toolbar_location=None,
           tools="hover", tooltips="@country: @value", x_range=(-0.5, 1.0),background_fill_color="darkkhaki")

p.wedge(x=0, y=1, radius=0.4,
        start_angle=cumsum('angle', include_zero=True), end_angle=cumsum('angle'),
        line_color="white", fill_color='color', legend_field='country', source=data)

p.axis.axis_label=None
p.axis.visible=False
p.grid.grid_line_color = None
p.title.text_color = "midnightblue"
p.title.text_font = "times"
p.title.text_font_style = "italic"
p.title.text_font_size = "18pt"
show(p)
source.676fd5c7:
from bokeh.palettes import Category10
z = {
    "Python":15530,
    "R":4277,
    "SQL":7535,
    "C":3315,
    "C++":3827,    
}

data = pd.Series(z).reset_index(name='value').rename(columns={'index':'country'})
data['angle'] = data['value']/data['value'].sum() * 2*pi
data['color'] = Category10[len(z)]

p = figure(plot_height=350, title="Coding language preference among Kagglers", toolbar_location=None,
           tools="hover", tooltips="@country: @value", x_range=(-0.5, 1.0),background_fill_color="palegoldenrod")

p.wedge(x=0, y=1, radius=0.4,
        start_angle=cumsum('angle', include_zero=True), end_angle=cumsum('angle'),
        line_color="white", fill_color='color', legend_field='country', source=data)

p.axis.axis_label=None
p.axis.visible=False
p.grid.grid_line_color = None
p.title.text_color = "midnightblue"
p.title.text_font = "times"
p.title.text_font_style = "italic"
p.title.text_font_size = "18pt"
show(p)

source.8a1310ce:
l = data2017.Age.to_numpy()
l=l.astype("int8")
l = l[np.logical_not(np.isnan(l))]
print(l)
# your range covers 25 a piece - and share start/endvalues.
# I presume [0-25[ ranges
def count(list1, l, r): 
    c = 0 
    # traverse in the list1 
    for x in list1: 
        # condition check 
        if x>= l and x<= r: 
            c+= 1 
    return c 
print(count(l,18,21))
print(count(l,22,24))
print(count(l,25,29))
print(count(l,30,34))
print(count(l,35,39))
print(count(l,40,44))
print(count(l,45,49))
print(count(l,50,54))
print(count(l,55,59))
print(count(l,60,69))
print(count(l,70,100))
source.9682fd58:
from bokeh.models import ColumnDataSource
from bokeh.plotting import figure, output_file, show
from bokeh.models.tickers import FixedTicker
from bokeh.plotting import figure, output_file, show

output_file("line.html")

p = figure(plot_width=1200, plot_height=600,tools="hover",tooltips="",title="Distribution of Kagglers in countries throughout the Years",background_fill_color="khaki")

# add a line renderer
p.square([2017,2018,2019,2020], [4197,4716,3085,2237],legend_label="America",color= "midnightblue",size=10)
p.line([2017,2018,2019,2020], [4197,4716,3085,2237], line_width=4,color="midnightblue")
p.square([2017,2018,2019,2020], [2704,4417,4786,5851],legend_label="India",color= "firebrick",size=10)
p.line([2017,2018,2019,2020], [2704,4417,4786,5851], line_width=4,color="firebrick")
p.square([2017,2018,2019,2020], [471,1644,574,474],legend_label="China",color= "slateblue",size=10)
p.line([2017,2018,2019,2020], [471,1644,574,474], line_width=4,color="slateblue")
p.square([2017,2018,2019,2020], [578,879,626,582],legend_label="Russia",color= "forestgreen",size=10)
p.line([2017,2018,2019,2020],[578,879,626,582], line_width=4,color="forestgreen")
p.square([2017,2018,2019,2020], [535,702,402,489],legend_label="United Kingdom and Ireland",color= "teal",size=10)
p.line([2017,2018,2019,2020],[535,702,402,489], line_width=4,color="teal")
p.square([2017,2018,2019,2020], [465,736,728,694],legend_label="Brazil",color= "olive",size=10)
p.line([2017,2018,2019,2020],[465,736,728,694], line_width=4,color="olive")
p.square([2017,2018,2019,2020], [465,736,728,404],legend_label="Germany",color= "indigo",size=10)
p.line([2017,2018,2019,2020],[460,734,531,404], line_width=4,color="indigo")
p.square([2017,2018,2019,2020], [442,604,392,330],legend_label="France",color= "sienna",size=10)
p.line([2017,2018,2019,2020],[442,604,392,330], line_width=4,color="sienna")
p.add_tools(HoverTool(
    tooltips=[
    ('Year', '@x'),
    ('Total No of People in Survey', '@y'),
  ],
))
p.xaxis.axis_label = 'Years'
p.yaxis.axis_label = 'No of People'
p.title.text_color = "maroon"
p.title.text_font = "helvetica"
p.title.text_font_style = "italic"
p.title.text_font_size = "18pt"
p.xaxis.ticker = FixedTicker(ticks=[2017,2018,2019,2020])
show(p)
source.c1091bbf:
from bokeh.models import ColumnDataSource
from bokeh.plotting import figure, output_file, show
from bokeh.models.tickers import FixedTicker
from bokeh.plotting import figure, output_file, show

output_file("line.html")

p = figure(plot_width=1200, plot_height=600,tools="hover",tooltips="",title="Distribution of Age in Kagglers throughout the Years",background_fill_color="lightslategrey")

# add a line renderer
p.square([2017,2018,2019,2020], [1250,3037,2502,3469],legend_label="18-21",color= "#1f77b4",size=10)
p.line([2017,2018,2019,2020], [1250,3037,2502,3469], line_width=4,color="#1f77b4")
p.square([2017,2018,2019,2020], [2431,5141,3610,3786],legend_label="22-24",color= "#ff7f0e",size=10)
p.line([2017,2018,2019,2020], [2431,5141,3610,3786], line_width=4,color="#ff7f0e")
p.square([2017,2018,2019,2020], [4189,6159,4458,4011],legend_label="25-29",color= "#2ca02c",size=10)
p.line([2017,2018,2019,2020],[4189,6159,4458,4011], line_width=4,color="#2ca02c")
p.square([2017,2018,2019,2020], [2996,3776,3120,2811],legend_label="30-34",color= "#d62728",size=10)
p.line([2017,2018,2019,2020],[2996,3776,3120,2811], line_width=4,color="#d62728")
p.square([2017,2018,2019,2020], [2033,2253,2087,1991],legend_label="35-39",color= "#9467bd",size=10)
p.line([2017,2018,2019,2020],[2033,2253,2087,1991], line_width=4,color="#9467bd")
p.square([2017,2018,2019,2020], [1241,1360,1439,1397],legend_label="40-44",color= "#8c564b",size=10)
p.line([2017,2018,2019,2020],[1241,1360,1439,1397], line_width=4,color="#8c564b")
p.square([2017,2018,2019,2020], [826,858,949,988],legend_label="45-49",color= "#e377c2",size=10)
p.line([2017,2018,2019,2020],[826,858,949,988], line_width=4,color="#e377c2")
p.square([2017,2018,2019,2020], [578,582,692,698],legend_label="50-54",color= "#7f7f7f",size=10)
p.line([2017,2018,2019,2020],[578,582,692,698], line_width=4,color="#7f7f7f")
p.square([2017,2018,2019,2020], [359,328,422,411],legend_label="55-59",color= "#17becf",size=10)
p.line([2017,2018,2019,2020],[359,328,422,411], line_width=4,color="#17becf")

p.add_tools(HoverTool(
    tooltips=[
    ('Year', '@x'),
    ('Total No of People in Survey', '@y'),
  ],
))
p.xaxis.axis_label = 'Years'
p.yaxis.axis_label = 'No of People'
p.title.text_color = "maroon"
p.title.text_font = "helvetica"
p.title.text_font_style = "italic"
p.title.text_font_size = "18pt"
p.xaxis.ticker = FixedTicker(ticks=[2017,2018,2019,2020])
p.yaxis.ticker = FixedTicker(ticks=[500,1000,1500,2000,2500,3000,3500,4000,4500,5000,5500,6000,6500])

show(p)

source.a614806c: Over the years , we can see how Data Science field in general , and even Kagglers have shifted to be young in age . The proportion of people is shifting towards 18-21 . However , one of the general findings is that there is an overall increase in the no of people for all age categories!!!
source.1f28ba06:
### *Fin*
Hi, thanks for reading my kernel ! 
I still seem to face problems with respect to sorting the q6 data chronologically and seperation of programming languages for every person to be one , to ascertain the true image.
source.1187d07e: There is an increase in participation on the Kaggle , from Asia, where India has a high participation in the same. Though some of the countries from survey seem to have reduced participation on Kaggle , however there is a general increase of participation from all the countries .
source.40b33fc0: It seems that Kaggle is heavily used in India, over 25% survey users are of India !!!, USA has 2nd highest users. It would be interesting to see the gender distribution in different countries.

source.3e9169d6:
#

Changes throughout the years through Survey Data

Well , the Kaggle Survey of 2020 gives meta picture of what has come to be of community in year 2020. However , to gain understanding of what it stands for , and where we are possibly heading , we need to analyze the data of previous years.
source.aced8ae5:
While currently it seems that majority of people are of 25-30 years old , however 18-25 years old are significantly high which means that Data science and even Kaggle is shifting towards youngsters more!

Over 50 people are active on Kaggle who are in their 70s , talk about dedication !!!
source.d9e24376: <h3 style="background-color:coral; color:white;text-align:center;font-size:125%">Changes in Age Distribution throughout the Years<h3>
source.7d0e950c:
#

Introduction

### *The greatest value of a picture is when it forces us to notice what we never expect to see* As the field of Data Science seems to flourish , Kaggle which is one of largest data science communities seems to grow as well , in this competition we are given the Kaggle Survey Data to analyze and present your own data story. Here's mine ...
source.512ad7be: We can see that Kaggle has high distibution of males than female , but what seems to be more astonishing is that for each 4 men there is 1 women . Almost 80% of Kaggle, is occupied by males.
source.8cd1445b:
#

What we learned from 2020?

Age Distribution of Kagglers
source.430e756e: The data clearly suggests that the majority of people have background of 3-5 years which means they had spent substantial amount of time in field of programming before encountering Kaggle. However , if we look at the figure of 1-2 years , we can see how Kaggle has started to spread among the newbies of programming field!
